info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 13 at 6:55AM CST until December 13 at 11:00AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM CST FOR CENTRAL PARKER COUNTY... At 654 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Brock, or 12 miles southeast of Mineral Wells, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Brock around 700 AM CST. Weatherford, Hudson Oaks, Annetta and Lake Weatherford around 730 AM CST. Willow Park around 735 AM CST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Brock Junction, Annetta South, Annetta North and Dennis. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter now! Get to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building and avoid windows.
